contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Wadayama'''|和田山町|Wadayama-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Asago District, Hyōgo|Asago District]], [[Hyōgo Prefecture|Hyōgo]], [[Japan]]. On April 1, 2005, Asago was merged with the towns of [[Asago, Hyōgo (Asago)|Asago]], [[Ikuno, Hyōgo|Ikuno]] and [[Santō, Hyōgo|Santō]], all from [[Asago District, Hyōgo|Asago District]], to form the new city of [[Asago, Hyōgo|Asago]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 17,129 and a [[population density|density]] of 153.47 persons per km². The total area was 111.61 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.asago.hyogo.jp/ Official website of Asago] in Japanese {{DEFAULTSORT:Wadayama, Hyogo}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hyōgo Prefecture]] {{Hyogo-geo-stub}}
